title: Definitions and Key Concepts
summary: Establishes consistent terminology and scope across the Framework.
dp: Ensure consistent interpretation in decisions and communications.
dr: Use correct definitions when preparing requests.
ds: Apply terms consistently in documentation and reporting.

title: Scope and Exclusions
summary: Defines what is covered and excluded (e.g., mock/test data not in scope).
dp: Confirm the request falls within Framework scope.
dr: Verify intended use is eligible before submission.
ds: Check synthesis methods align with in-scope definitions.

title: Legal and Policy Framework
summary: Outlines applicable privacy and health-data regulations and guidance.
dr: Understand obligations for lawful data use.
ds: Respect legal constraints when designing synthesis pipelines.

title: Use-Case Assessment Form
summary: Evaluates purpose, ethics, and public benefit for synthetic-data use.
dp: Review, verify, and approve ethical and public-benefit claims.
dr: Complete and justify use case and benefits.

title: Impact Assessment Form
summary: Assesses ethical, social, and organisational impacts of proposed use.
dp: Review and decide on acceptability or mitigation.
dr: Provide impact responses and supporting evidence.
ds: Supply quantitative impact metrics if applicable.

title: Technical Assessment
summary: Evaluates data readiness and technical suitability for synthesis.
dp: Verify data ownership and quality for lawful processing.
ds: Conduct data profiling, quality checks, and readiness reporting.

title: De-Identification Techniques Guide
summary: Provides technical guidance to reduce re-identification risk.
ds: Implement, test, and document privacy-preserving transformations.

title: Decision Tree for Complex Requests
summary: Guides decision-making for borderline or multi-party cases.
dp: Apply escalation logic to complex cases.
dr: Provide additional context and clarifications when requested.
ds: Contribute technical detail for decision rationale.

title: Lawful Pathways for Synthetic Data Use
summary: Maps legal pathways and data-sharing approvals for each use type.
dp: Determine lawful basis and ensure compliance.
dr: Align project with correct lawful category.
ds: Ensure technical handling honours the chosen legal pathway.

title: Safety Assessment (Five Safes)
summary: Confirms privacy and security safeguards across five domains.
dp: Complete and approve overall Safety Assessment.
ds: Document Safe-Data and Safe-Settings technical controls.

title: Request & Assessment Outcomes Form
summary: Records results of each assessment and final approval.
dp: Complete, sign, and archive final decision.
dr: Provide inputs and retain outcome copy.
ds: Attach supporting technical evidence from Steps 2â€“5.
